parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tag names (and optionally values). Example: tag1,tag2=value2

Repeatability-Result.description: Indicates whether the repeatable request was accepted or rejected.

values.name: accepted
values.description: If the request was accepted and the server guarantees that the server state reflects a single execution of the operation.

values.name: rejected
values.description:
If the request was rejected because the combination of Repeatability-First-Sent and Repeatability-Request-ID were invalid
or because the Repeatability-First-Sent value was outside the range of values held by the server.

AIContent.description: An abstract representation of a structured content item within a chat message.

AIContentUpdate.description: Streaming update for AI content in a message.

i.description: The index in the content list.

d.description: The delta operation applied to the AI content.

Agent.description: Represents an AI agent with configuration, instructions, and tool access.

agentId.description: A unique identifier for the agent.

description.description: A description of the agent; used for display purposes and to describe the agent.

metadata.description: Arbitrary metadata associated with this agent.

AgentConfigurationOptions.description: Options used when creating and an agent or completing a run without an existing agent.

displayName.description: The display name of the agent; used for display purposes and sent to the LLM to identify the agent.

agentModel.description: The model definition for this agent. This is optional (not needed) when doing a run using persistent agent.

instructions.description: Instructions provided to guide how this agent operates.

tools.description: A list of tool definitions available to the agent.

toolChoice.description: How the agent should choose among provided tools.

AgentMessage.description: An agent message within a chat, always with the 'agent' role.

content.description: The contents of the agent message.

AgentModel.description: Represents the model or provider-specific data used by the agent.

id.description: A unique model or deployment ID for this agent model.

provider.description: The name of the provider for this model (e.g., 'openai').

endpoint.description: An endpoint where the provider can be reached, if applicable.

AgentToolDefinition.description: Represents a definition of a tool that an agent may use, used in a polymorphic manner.

type.description: Discriminates the various child 'tool definition' types.

options.description: Additional options that specify the behavior of this tool (also polymorphic).

override.description: A set of overrides for the tool's name, description, or parameters.

name.description: An alternate name for the tool.

description.description: An alternate description for the tool.

parameters.description: An alternate JSON schema for the tool's parameters.

AgentToolOptions.description: Base type for any agent tool-specific options, used in a polymorphic manner.

type.description: Discriminates the various child 'tool options' types.

Annotations.description: Annotations applied to parts of the message or content.

ToolCallId.description: The tool call ID associated with the annotation.

jsonPath.description: The JSON path associated with the annotation.

url.description: The URL associated with the annotation.

start.description: The start position of the annotation.

end.description: The end position of the annotation.

values.name: text
values.description: `text` format should be used for requests involving any sort of ToolCall.

values.name: jsonObject
values.description: Using `json_object` format will limit the usage of ToolCall to only functions.

AppendStreamingOperation.description: Appends a value to a list at a JSON path.

value.description: The value to apply to the operation, expressed as a JSON-compatible type.

AssistantsApiResponseFormat.description: An object describing the expected output of the model. If `json_object` only `function` type `tools` are allowed to be passed to the Run. If `text` the model can return text or any value needed.

values.name: text
values.description: `text` format should be used for requests involving any sort of ToolCall.

values.name: jsonObject
values.description: Using `json_object` format will limit the usage of ToolCall to only functions.

AssistantsApiResponseFormatMode.description: Represents the mode in which the model will handle the return format of a tool call.

values.name: auto
values.description: Default value. Let the model handle the return format.

values.name: none
values.description: Setting the value to `none`, will result in a 400 Bad request.

AudioContent.description: A structured chat content item containing an audio reference.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

AuthorRole.description: Possible roles of the message author.

AutoToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying an automatic choice among the given tools.

toolNames.description: The tool names from which the agent can automatically choose.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Microsoft One API guidelines - https://github.com/Microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#7102-error-condition-responses.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

connectionName.description: Name of connection to Azure AI Search

indexName.description: Name of index in Azure AI Search resource to attach

AzureAgentModel.description: A specialized AgentModel for Azure-based providers.

options.description: The provider-specific options for this Azure-based model.

AzureModelOptions.description: A set of provider-specific configuration and behavior options for Azure-based models.

provider.description: Identifies this model options object as an Azure-based provider.

temperature.description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

topP.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

type.description: Type of credential. Possible values are: AAD, SAS, ApiKey

BingGroundingToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for Microsoft Bing grounding.

connectionName.description: The name of the Bing grounding connection.

BlobReferenceForConsumption.description: Represents a reference to a blob for consumption

blobUri.description: Blob URI path for client to upload data. Example: https://blob.windows.core.net/Container/Path

storageAccountArmId.description: ARM ID of the storage account to use.

credential.description: Credential info to access the storage account.

ChatMessage.description: A base model for representing a chat message.

userId.description: The ID of the user who created the message (if applicable).

agentId.description: The ID of the agent who created the message (if applicable).

messageId.description: A unique identifier for this message.

agentRunId.description: A unique run ID, if this message was generated by a run process.

conversationId.description: The conversation to which this message belongs.

role.description: The role of this message's author.

authorName.description: An optional display name for the author.

createdAt.description: The timestamp (in Unix time) when this message was created.

completedAt.description: The timestamp (in Unix time) when this message was completed, if applicable.

ChatMessageUpdate.description: Streaming update for a chat message.

d.description: The delta operation applied to the message.

CodeInterpreterToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for the OpenAI Code Interpreter.

fileIds.description: A list of file IDs this code interpreter requires.

CompletionUsage.description: Detailed token usage data for a run request.

outputTokens.description: Number of run (completion) tokens used over the course of the run.

inputTokens.description: Number of prompt tokens used over the course of the run step.

totalTokens.description: Total number of tokens used (prompt + run).

cachedTokens.description: The number of cached prompt tokens.

outputTokenDetails.description: Breakdown of tokens used in a run.

reasoningTokens.description: Tokens generated by the model for reasoning.

target.description: The connection URL to be used for this service

ConnectionType.description: The Type (or category) of the connection

values.name: APIKey
values.description: Generic connection that uses API Key authentication

ContentFilterContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a content filter.

Conversation.description: Represents a chat conversation, which can contain multiple messages.

conversationId.description: A unique identifier for this conversation.

messages.description: A list of messages in this conversation.

d.description: The delta operation applied to the conversation.

DataPathAssetReference.description: Reference to an asset via its path in a datastore.

datastoreId.description: ARM resource ID of the datastore where the asset is located.

path.description: The path of the file/directory in the datastore.

DatasetType.description: Enum to determine the type of data.

isReference.description: Indicates if dataset is reference only or managed by dataset service. If true, the underlying data will be deleted when the dataset version is deleted

id.description: A unique identifier for the asset, assetId probably?

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

DeploymentType.description: Represents the type of the deployment. Known literal is 'ModelDeployment'

DeveloperMessage.description: A developer message within a chat, always with the 'developer' role.

content.description: The contents of the developer message.

modelDeploymentName.description: Deployment name of embedding model. It can point to a model deployment either in the parent AIServices or a connection.

displayName.description: Display Name for evaluation. It helps to find the evaluation easily in AI Foundry. It does not need to be unique.

description.description: Description of the evaluation. It can be used to store additional information about the evaluation and is mutable.

status.description: Status of the evaluation. It is set by service and is read-only.

tags.description: Evaluation's tags. Unlike properties, tags are fully mutable.

properties.description: Evaluation's properties. Unlike tags, properties are add-only. Once added, a property cannot be removed.

evaluators.description: Evaluators to be used for the evaluation.

ExtraParameters.description: Controls what happens if extra parameters, undefined by the REST API, are passed in the JSON request payload.

values.name: error
values.description: The service will error if it detected extra parameters in the request payload. This is the service default.

values.name: drop
values.description: The service will ignore (drop) extra parameters in the request payload. It will only pass the known parameters to the back-end AI model.

values.name: pass_through
values.description: The service will pass extra parameters to the back-end AI model.

FileContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a file data item.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

openAIPurpose.description: Indicates OpenAI Purpose. FileDatasets created with this field will be compatible with OpenAI-specific features

FileSearchToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for the OpenAI File Search feature.

maxNumResults.description: The maximum number of search results to return (optional).

rankingOptions.description: Extra ranking options, including a threshold and a ranker.

ranker.description: The name of the ranker algorithm.

fileIds.description: A list of file IDs to be searched.

FunctionToolDefinition.description: Definitions for a function-based tool behavior.

description.description: An optional description for the function-based tool.

parameters.description: A JSON schema describing the function's parameters.

strict.description: Indicates whether strict validation is required.

IdAssetReference.description: Reference to an asset via its ARM resource ID.

assetId.description: [Required] ARM resource ID of the asset.

ImageContent.description: A structured chat content item containing an image reference.

width.description: Width of the image in pixels (optional).

height.description: Height of the image in pixels (optional).

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

id.description: A unique identifier for the asset, assetId probably?

tags.description: Tag dictionary. Tags can be added, removed, and updated.

IndexType.description: Enumerates known index types, but also allows any custom string fallback.

JSONAny.description: A JSON-compatible type that can be a primitive, object, or array.

floatValue.description: A floating-point (double precision) value, if present.

nullValue.description: Indicates this represents a JSON null if set to true.

arrayValue.description: A JSON array, if present, expressed as an array of JSONAny elements.

objectValue.description: A JSON object, if present, expressed as a dictionary from string to JSONAny.

JSONSchema.description: Represents a JSON schema describing object properties and required fields.

properties.description: The properties defined in this JSON schema.

required.description: A list of required property names in this schema.

ListSortOrder.description: The available sorting options when requesting a list of response objects.

ManagedAzureAISearchIndex.description: Managed Azure AI Search Index Definition

vectorStoreId.description: Vector store id of managed index

MessageRole.description: The possible values for roles attributed to messages in a conversation.

modelName.description: Publisher-specific name of the deployed model

modelVersion.description: Publisher-specific version of the deployed model

modelPublisher.description: Name of the deployed model's publisher

connectionName.description: Name of the connection the deployment comes from

NoRequest.description: A no-op model to represent an empty request.

NoneToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying that no tools may be chosen.

OpenAIAgentModel.description: A specialized AgentModel for OpenAI-based providers.

options.description: The provider-specific options for this OpenAI-based model.

OpenAIModelOptions.description: A set of provider-specific configuration and behavior options for OpenAI.

temperature.description:
The sampling temperature to use that controls the apparent creativity of generated completions.
Higher values will make output more random while lower values will make results more focused
and deterministic.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

topP.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature called nucleus sampling. This value causes the
model to consider the results of tokens with the provided probability mass. As an example, a
value of 0.15 will cause only the tokens comprising the top 15% of probability mass to be
considered.
It is not recommended to modify temperature and topP for the same completions request as the
interaction of these two settings is difficult to predict.

OpenApiToolDefinition.description: A tool definition for an OpenAI-based API described by an OpenAPI specification.

name.description: The name of the OpenAPI-based tool.

openApiSpec.description: A string containing the raw OpenAPI specification data.

OutputPathAssetReference.description: Reference to an asset via its path in a job output.

jobId.description: ARM resource ID of the job.

path.description: The path of the file/directory in the job output.

value.description: The ChatMessage items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

PendingUploadCredentialType.description: The type of credential used to access the storage account.

PendingUploadRequest.description: Represents a request for a pending upload.

pendingUploadId.description: If PendingUploadId is not provided, a random GUID will be used.

connectionName.description: Name of Azure blob storage connection to use for generating temporary SAS token

pendingUploadType.description: TemporaryBlobReference is the only supported type.

PendingUploadResponse.description: Represents the response for a pending upload request

datasetVersion.description: Version of dataset to be created if user did not specify version when initially creating upload

pendingUploadType.description: TemporaryBlobReference is the only supported type

values.name: temporaryBlobReference
values.description: Temporary Blob Reference is the only supported type.

ReferenceType.description: Enum to determine which reference method to use for an asset.

RefusalContent.description: A structured chat content item containing model refusal information for a structured outputs request.

RemoveStreamingOperation.description: Removes part of a value at a JSON path.

ReplaceStreamingOperation.description: Replaces part of a string value at a JSON path.

RequiredToolChoiceBehavior.description: Behavior specifying that the agent must always use the listed tools.

toolNames.description: The tool names that the agent must use.

Run.description: An agent-generated run record, including both the requested inputs and the final outputs.

createdAt.description: Timestamp when the run was initiated (Unix time).

completedAt.description: Timestamp when the run finished processing (Unix time).

runInputs.description: The inputs that were used to start this run.

userId.description: Identifier for the user making the request.

store.description: Flag indicating whether to store the run and associated messages.

status.description: Final status of the run request. Known values: 'inProgress', 'incomplete', 'cancelled', 'failed', 'completed' - or custom string.

output.description: List of output messages generated by the agent.

usage.description: Token usage details for this run.

incompleteDetails.description: Details about why the response is incomplete, if applicable.

RunInputs.description: Parameters for creating a new run request.

agentId.description: Unique identifier for the agent responsible for the run. This is optional (not needeed) when doing a run using ephemeral agent.

input.description: The list of input messages for the run.

conversationId.description: Optional identifier for an existing conversation.

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the run request.

userId.description: Identifier for the user making the request.

agentConfiguration.description: The agent configuration when not using a previously created agent.

RunOptions.description: Represents advanced options for controlling agent runs.

truncationStrategy.description: Strategy for truncating messages when input exceeds model limits.

RunOutputs.description: Fields describing the final run outcome, including status, output messages, and usage.

status.description: Final status of the run request. Known values: 'inProgress', 'incomplete', 'cancelled', 'failed', 'completed' - or custom string.

output.description: List of output messages generated by the agent.

usage.description: Token usage details for this run.

incompleteDetails.description: Details about why the response is incomplete, if applicable.

RunOutputsStatus.description: Known status values for a run, plus a fallback string for unrecognized statuses.

values.name: incomplete
values.description: The run did not produce a complete output.

d.description: The delta operation applied to the run.

SetStreamingOperation.description: Sets (overwrites) the value at a JSON path.

value.description: The value to apply to the operation, expressed as a JSON-compatible type.

StreamingAgentCompletionUpdate.description: A streaming update indicating incremental changes to an agent-generated completion.

messageId.description: Identifier of the message being updated.

authorName.description: Optional name of the message author.

authorRole.description: Role of the author for the updated message.

update.description: Optional content updates from the AI.

usage.description: Token usage information associated with this streaming update.

StreamingOperation.description: Represents an operation to update a specific JSON path with streamed data.

jsonPath.description: The JSON path to the operation.

type.description: The type of operation being performed.

StreamingUpdate.description: The delta operation applied to the resource.

d.description: The delta operation applied to the resource.

type.description: The type of the streaming update.

SystemMessage.description: A system message within a chat, always with the 'system' role.

content.description: The contents of the system message.

TextContent.description: A structured chat content item containing plain text.

annotations.description: A list of annotations in the text content.

ToolCallContent.description: A structured chat content item describing a tool call request.

name.description: The name of the tool to call.

toolCallId.description: The unique ID of the tool call.

arguments.description: Arguments passed to this tool call, expressed as JSON-like data rather than `unknown`.

ToolChoiceBehavior.description: The base behavior for how an agent chooses among available tools.

ToolMessage.description: A tool message within a chat, always with the 'tool' role.

toolCallId.description: The ID of the tool call to which this result pertains.

content.description: The contents of the tool message.

ToolResultContent.description: A structured chat content item describing a tool result.

results.description: The results returned from the tool, using JSONAny instead of `unknown`.

TruncationStrategy.description: Describes how to truncate messages if they exceed model or provider limits.

type.description: The type of truncation strategy to apply. Known values: 'auto', 'lastMessages', or a custom string.

lastMessages.description: The number of most recent messages to retain when using 'lastMessages' strategy.

TruncationStrategyType.description: Enumerates known truncation strategy types, but also allows any custom fallback string.

values.name: auto
values.description: Automatically truncate messages to fit limits.

values.name: lastMessages
values.description: Truncate older messages, keeping only the last few.

UserMessage.description: A user message within a chat, always with the 'user' role.

content.description: The contents of the user message.

VideoContent.description: A structured chat content item containing a video reference.

fileName.description: The file name for this binary content.

mimeType.description: The MIME type for this binary content.

uri.description: URI where the binary content can be retrieved.

dataUri.description: Data URI containing the binary content inlined.

data.description: Raw bytes for the binary content.

Azure.Core.ClientRequestIdHeader.name: x-ms-client-request-id
Azure.Core.ClientRequestIdHeader.description: An opaque, globally-unique, client-generated string identifier for the request.

Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.name: api-version
Azure.Core.Foundations.ApiVersionParamet.description: The API version to use for this operation.

Azure.Core.MaxPageSizeQueryParameter.name: maxpagesize
Azure.Core.MaxPageSizeQueryParameter.description: The maximum number of result items per page.

Azure.Core.RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.r.name: Repeatability-First-Sent
Azure.Core.RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.r.description: Specifies the date and time at which the request was first created.

Azure.Core.RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.r.name: Repeatability-Request-ID
Azure.Core.RepeatabilityRequestHeaders.r.description: An opaque, globally-unique, client-generated string identifier for the request.

Azure.Core.SkipQueryParameter.name: skip
Azure.Core.SkipQueryParameter.description: The number of result items to skip.

Azure.Core.TopQueryParameter.name: top
Azure.Core.TopQueryParameter.description: The number of result items to return.
